main event: A military report documented a sighting of a bright green circular object observed at Bentwaters, England on December 22, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as being 60-90 feet in size and moving at a speed of 35-40 mph., It appeared to have a rotating motion and would disappear behind trees before reappearing., Another observer, located 4 miles SSW, thought they saw a 'meteorite' at around the same time., No corroborating evidence was produced from local radar units or pilots., The conclusion suggested that a meteorite-type phenomenon could be the most probable explanation.
witness description: Military personnel including Captain Albert M. Ries
